page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: The main physical features of this area are a scarp and dip slope which runs north-south along the eastern boundary and the river Witham which meanders north-east linking the three villages situated within this area. The villages of Belton,Syston and Barkston origonally straddled the A607 as it ran north from Grantham.However the introduction of bypasses has effectively isolated Belton and Syston. The National Trust operates Belton House,formally owned by the Brownlow and Cust families. About 3/4 mile north of Belton lies Syston.Syston Old Hall is positioned centrally and is the home of the Thorold family. Barkston is situated a further half mile north.The village contains a primary school,post office and garage.
